moves.1. d4: The start of Queen's pawn game. I usually prefer use King's pawn game.
moves.1... Nc6: I didn't know how to react so I chose to try Alekhine's Defence on the Queen side.
moves.2. d5: He threatens my knight with his pawn.
moves.3... c6: I threaten his pawn, hoping to get my knight back into a position that I feel comfortable. So much for Alekhine's Defence.
moves.4. Bf4: He threatens my knight with his bishop…
moves.4... Ng6: …And I retreat, threatening his bishop. Now my knight is on the other side of the board, right near to my other knight!
moves.6... Nf6: I open up my other knight.
moves.7. Bd3: He opens up his bishop, preparing for: Nf3 and then O-O.
moves.7... Bc5: I open up my bishop, and I am now in a position to castle.
moves.8. Ne2: I would prefer to play Nf3.
moves.8... Ng4: I push up knight further, looking for a gap or a free pawn.
moves.9. h3: He threatens my knight and I am forced to…
moves.10... d6: I give my pawn double-protection and prepare to open up my bishop.
moves.12. b4: He threatens my bishop while being protected by his a-pawn that he had pushed up last turn.
moves.13. Kh1: I don't know what he's doing here apart from placing his king right in the corner.
moves.13... Nh5: I threaten his bishop with my knight.
moves.15. bxa5: He takes it. The first piece has been taken!
moves.15... Bxa5: I take his pawn with my bishop.
moves.16. f4: A move that will turn out to be the start of a mass-swap.
moves.19. Rxf4: …And he takes my knight with his rook who is now open.
moves.20... g5: I threaten his rook with my pawn.
moves.21... Bd7: I open up my bishop, giving him access to the right side of the board.
moves.22... Bc3: I threaten his rook with my bishop.
moves.23. Rc1: He moves out of the way.
moves.23... Bb2: I fork the rook and the pawn. Now I have at least a free pawn.
moves.24... Bxa3: But I just take the free pawn.
moves.25. Nf3: He threatens my pawn uselessly, due to the fact that my queen is protecting it.
moves.25... Ba4: The first really good move. I pin his rook to his queen.
moves.26. e5: He threatens my pawn, a threat that will be ignored:
moves.27. Qxc2: I am plus three up and happy with my position with an extra pawn and rook.
moves.28. Bxh7+: He checks me while being protected by the queen. Now I'm not a pawn up. :(
moves.29. Qf5: He moves his queen out of the way of my rook, but sill protects the bishop.
moves.30. e6: And he goes straight past me. Now he's two squares away from promoting! :O
moves.31... Rc8: I retreat back to make sure promoting can't be possible.
moves.32. Re1: He protects his pawn, threatening: e7. Forking my rook and queen! :O
moves.32... Qe7: I put my queen in the way, halting his run.
moves.33... Bb4: I prepare to threaten his queen with my rook, also directly threatening his rook.
moves.34. Qd4: He moves out of the way of the threat, delivering a threat of his own on my bishop, but he doesn't see the threat on his rook..
moves.35. Nxg5: He takes my pawn for free. My pawn can't take his knight because of the queen pinning it.
moves.35... Rc1: I prepare for: Bf2 or Bc3.
moves.36. Nf7+: He checks me with his knight. Suicide!
moves.37. Kh2: He halts the threat of Bf2 or Bc3.
moves.38. Bf5: He moves out of the way.
moves.39... Rd1: I prepare to move my bishop to d4, which then allows to me to play: Rg1, threatening mate.
moves.40... Kg8: I move to my only safe square. Rh7 would result in mate for white.
moves.41... Be5+: I check him, and his only option is: g3.
moves.42... Bxg3+: I take his pawn, checking his king.
moves.43... Rd2+: I check him with my rook.
moves.44. Kf1: He moves out of the way.
moves.44... Rf2+: I check him, now his options are mate in 2 for me, or a free queen for me.
moves.45... Rxf5+: I move my rook out of the way - check - and after he moves his king, I am free to take his queen.
moves.46. Kd1: I am free to take his queen! :D
moves.46... Rxh5:
I take it and he resigns. :D
That was such a good game! One of my highest rated players ever one against on blitz or in real games! Good game vertolet!
